items.text: nice dip and turn, takes the outside edge on the drive and rolls to short third man
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: speared on off, too full to get under the length, stabbed back to Raza
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: good length and angling away outside off, watchfully run away to backward point
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.preText: AnikZ: "Interesting to see Shakib come in at 3. Perhaps part of a new look Bangladesh batting order going forward and one being decided by captain and senior players with the lack of a head coach"
items.text: full and angling away outside off, stabs a drive down the ground, bisecting mid-on and mid-off
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.preText: Kamrul: "I wonder the batting order, why is Shakib promoted at no.3? Is it because he needs some batting practice or the team management wants to experiment?"
items.text: short, wide, Shakib has a crack at it and skies it to third man
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.preText: Aniruddha Das: "Anamul should have been warned for playing such irresponsible shot. He should know the level where he stands and what are the expectations from him,"
items.text: back of a length, tip and run to the off side, beside the pitch
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.text: shorter and angling away outside off, Shakib rides the bounce and guides the ball to backward point
items.postText: wall_33: "kyle jarvis may not be a white ball bowler but right now streak doesnt have many options..zimbabwe pace attack isnt very strong and jarvis appears to be best among them..even today he hasnt bowled badly"
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: eases it off the pads to long leg to close out the over
items.postText: Fergie: "@Outkast Hey, ya! I think you've got it! But I think Jarvis has got the nod based purely on his experience, including on the County circuit."
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: angling in from around the wicket and then ripping away past the outside edge
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: sliding into the pads, nurdled to midwicket on the front foot
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: really full on leg stump, no turn, jabbed out to midwicket
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: dangled up on middle, forward and smothered with caution
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: straight ball on middle, Tamim gets on the front foot and plays it back to the bowler
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: leg-stump full-toss, Tamim can't whack it to the boundary. Instead, he flicks and finds deep midwicket
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Tamim Iqbal, 2 runs

items.text: back of a length and angling away outside off, a crease-bound Shakib drags it against the angle to mid-on
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.preText: Sanny: "With due respect to Zimbabwe but this are exactly the type of games where you can try all the experiments, so I can fully understand to try Shakib here at No. 3. If it pays off, this might be another option for the rest of the Tri-Series. These kind of experiments wouldn´t be made in games against higher ranked teams."
items.text: back of a length and outside off, Shakib drives gloriously on the up but can't place it past cover
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: shorter on middle stump, blocked back to the bowler
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: dug in short and wide outside off, Shakib jumps off the ground and scythes an upper-cut over backward point
items.postText: Kamrul: "Unless Anamul keeps getting out in 20s and 30s, he would have the full series to restore his position. If he can't however, Bangladesh will have a major headache finding the perfect partner for Tamim since Soumya has been in disastrous form for quite some time."
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Shakib Al Hasan, FOUR runs

items.text: the debutant keeps offering up Shakib width outside off, he laps it up and bashes a cover-drive
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Shakib Al Hasan, FOUR runs

items.preText: Moony: "@Sanny Fair point, but not too long ago, Zimbabwe were a higher ranked team than Bangladesh. "
items.text: three boundaries in a row for Shakib. Anamul applauds from the change room. Back of a length and outside off, he stands tall and simply punches through the line and watches the ball skip away through the covers
items.shortText: Muzarabani to Shakib Al Hasan, FOUR runs

items.text: slightly back of a length and outside off, Tamim employs the latest of late cuts and steers the ball to third man
items.shortText: Chatara to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.text: slower cutter outside off, Shakib wafts early and makes no contact. Zimbabwe need to try more change-ups or attack the body
items.shortText: Chatara to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.preText: Irs: "@Kamrul: Imrul Kayes is not bad though..."
items.text: back of a length and skids in towards off stump, jabbed into the covers
items.shortText: Chatara to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: off-stump ball, turned into the vacant spaces at midwicket for a single
items.shortText: Chatara to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: floated full and outside off, Tamim stretches forward, opens the face and dabs the ball to backward point
items.shortText: Chatara to Tamim Iqbal, no run
